alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 29 at 10:21AM AKST until January 29 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Blowing snow will result in significantly reduced visibility. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Homer, Seldovia, Southern Kenai Peninsula. * WHEN...From 7 AM this morning to 9 PM AKST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is expected to develop later this morning as bitterly cold air moves across Kamishak Bay through the southern Cook Inlet. Communities across the southern end of the Kenai Peninsula such as Anchor Point, Homer, Seldovia, and areas along Kachemak Bay may experience near whiteout conditions at times as winds gust as high as 50 mph. Snow and strong southwest wind will taper off in the evening and overnight hours.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
